Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Analyzed the sequence of events for CaseID A1 and CaseID B2 to identify consistent patterns in the manufacturing process.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Inferred that events such as retrieving, scanning, placing, aligning, and preheating logically belong to a 'Material Preparation' step.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Based on consistent event sequences across CaseIDs A1 and B2, generalized the grouping logic to apply to similar cases.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Proposed that 'Quality Inspection' could be divided into multiple stages or grouped into a single step.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Checked that the timestamps and logical flow supported the proposed groupings of 'Material Preparation,' 'Assembly,' 'Quality Inspection,' and 'Coating Application.'

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: Revisited the grouping logic to consider splitting 'Quality Inspection' into multiple steps but decided to maintain a single grouping for simplicity.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Concluded that grouping based on process flow rather than resource type provides a clearer understanding of the manufacturing workflow.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Observed that all events follow a logical sequence: preparation, assembly, inspection, and coating.
